column4: i am having issues with my dual boot. I added a new hard disk whish works fine. Ubuntu loads up find as well but VISTA has a problem: "BOOTMGR.EXE is missing"... Info -> http://paste.ubuntu.com/118500/
any help?
How did you add the extra HD?
i added the hard disk in the pc: popped a sata cable in and power cable
and started the pc
Ok, as a spare HardDrive?
no i formatted it as fat
it is used as a storage disk
Go into your BIOS settings and make sure it's not set to boot from that Hard Drive first.
It looks like it's scanning the new hard drive first for the boot manager.
does that matter? grub should know which drive holds windows? (maybe i am wrong√†
i will check it at once
Well, Grub is more for Linux than Windows.
i also noticed that BOOT folder and BOOTMGR was on my "data2" disk
If that fails, fix the boot with your Vista Installation disk.
i read on UbuntuForums that it should be cut and pasted onto the Vista partition
is this an optin to try out?
fix it how? "restore windows installation" ?

I'm not sure about copying the boot manager.  No, you have the option to repair windows, but this will also mess up the GRUB Boot Manager, which you will need to use your LiveCD to restore it after you get Windows working again.
I personally recommend formattting the new drive to a Linux format, such as ext3.
That way Windows ignores it.
